document.masterDocTitle: Description of eleven new species of phytoseiid mites (Acari: Mesostigmata) from Meghalaya state, north eastern India

mods:titleInfo.mods:title: Description of eleven new species of phytoseiid mites (Acari: Mesostigmata) from Meghalaya state, north eastern India

heading.emphasis:
Key to the species of
Amblyseius
described or reported from India .

paragraph.keyLead:
3. StIV longer than 200.............................................
A . conulus Karmakar, Bhowmik & Sherpa, 2017

4. Calyx wider at the base of vesicle...................................................
A . herbicolus ( Chant, 1959 )

- Seta s4 long 105–110..................................
A . coffeae Sadanandan, 2006
(not
A . coffeae De Leon, 1961
).
12. Seta z4 long, as long as 2/3 distance between bases of z4 and s4 ............................................... 13
- Seta z4 short, not as long as 2/3 distance between bases of z4 and s4 ............................................ 14

- z4 and z2 are equal length............................................
A . mulberricus Sadanandan & Ramani, 2007

15. Dorsum having notch at the level of R1 .................................
A . excelsus Chaudhri, Akbar & Rasool, 1979

16. Tibia of leg IV without macrosetae.................................................
A . rangatensis Gupta, 1977a

18. Calyx capsule like with spiny outer surface.......................
A . parbatabasii Karmakar, Bhowmik & Sherpa, 2017

21. Calyx bell-shaped with bean-shaped atrium............................................
A . crotolariae Gupta, 1977c
- Calyx swollen basally then narrowing and finally flaring distally............................................... 22

22. Calyx with tubular base, followed by a constriction and afterwards with divergent arms distally.........
A . azaliae
sp. nov.

23. Calyx flared at the atrium..................................................
A . raoiellus
Denmark & Muma, 1989

- Calyx straight not flared at atrium.....................................................
A . orientalis Ehara, 1959
24. Spermatheca with calyx dish, disc, cup, bell or V-shaped..................................................... 25

- Z5 shorter 80–100, serrated, SgeIV shorter 50–60, movable digit with three teeth................
A . eujeniae Gupta, 1977a

32. SgeIV longer 100–110...........................................
A . apocynae Chinniah & Mohanasundaram, 2001

34. Dorsum smooth anteriorly but rugose posteriorly............
A . channabasavannai Gupta & Daniel, 1978
in Gupta, 1978b

35. Calyx of spermatheca very short................................
A . brachycalyx Karmakar, Bhowmik &Sherpa, 2017

36. All the three macrosetae of leg IV equal in length........................................
A . mcmurtryi Muma, 1967
- All the three macrosetae of leg IV not equal in length........................................................ 37

37. Movable digit toothless.............................................
A . malabarensis Anithalatha & Ramani, 2004

39. Calyx elongated flared at atrium, movable digit with five backwardly directed teeth............................................................................................
A . bengalensis Karmakar, Bhowmik & Sherpa, 2017

- Calyx elongated not flared at atrium, movable digit with four backwardly directed teeth...........................................................................................
A . dahliae Karmakar, Bhowmik & Sherpa, 2017

41. Fixed digit of chelicerae with twelve teeth & movable with four teeth........................
A . adhatodae Muma, 1967

- Fixed digit of chelicerae with ten to eleven teeth and movable with one tooth.......
A . metaliensis Karmakar & Gupta, 2014

43. Posterior margin of sternal shield wavy...............................................
A . guajavae Gupta, 1978c

- Posterior margin of sternal shield almost straight................
A . pseudoorientalis Chinniah & Mohanasundaram, 2001
